Summary: Regression Testing for Existing Login Flow
Description: Conduct regression tests to ensure that the existing login flow is not affected by the new password reset feature.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Existing login functionality works as expected post-implementation.
No new errors are introduced in the login process.
All existing login test cases pass successfully.

Description: Implement a feature that allows users to reset their password using a one-time code sent via email.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User receives an OTP via email upon requesting a password reset.
OTP expires 10 minutes after being sent.
User can successfully reset password using a valid OTP.

Description: Ensure that the OTP expires 10 minutes after being sent to the user.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Expired OTP results in an error message when used.
System does not allow password reset with an expired OTP.
User can request a new OTP after expiration.

Description: Implement rate limiting to prevent abuse of the OTP request feature.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User can request a maximum of 3 OTPs per hour.
Exceeding the limit results in an error message.
Rate limit resets after one hour.

Summary: Audit Event for Successful Password Reset
Description: Log an audit event whenever a password is successfully reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Audit event is logged with timestamp and user ID.
Audit event is accessible in system logs.
Audit event does not contain sensitive information.
